<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>

<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_IdleLoop_Impl:
```c
void OS_IdleLoop_Impl(void)
{
    /*
     * Unblock signals and wait for something to occur
     *
     * Note - "NormalSigMask" was calculated during task init to be the original signal mask
     * of the process PLUS all "RT" signals.  The RT signals are used by timers, so we want
     * to keep them masked here (this is different than the original POSIX impl).  The
     * timebase objects have a dedicated thread that will be doing "sigwait" on those.
     */
    sigsuspend(&POSIX_GlobalVars.NormalSigMask);
}
```
</target_code>

void OS_IdleLoop()
{
    /*
     * Wait until the shutdown value is set to the shutdown number
     * In most "real" embedded systems, this will never happen.
     * However it will happen in debugging situations (CTRL+C, etc).
     */
    while (OS_SharedGlobalVars.GlobalState != OS_SHUTDOWN_MAGIC_NUMBER)
    {
        OS_IdleLoop_Impl();
    }
}

void OS_Application_Run(void)
{
    OS_IdleLoop();
}

explanation:
MISRA Rule 14.3 applies to loop controlling expressions. In the provided code the only loop construct present is the while loop above (reported). Other code fragments do not contain loop controlling expressions and therefore are not relevant to Rule 14.3: 
- OS_IdleLoop_Impl contains no loop; it only calls sigsuspend. 
- OS_Application_Run simply calls OS_IdleLoop; it has no loop itself. 
- UT_ExecuteBasicHandler contains an if and function calls but no loop controlling expression. 
- The shown initializations and function calls (e.g. UT_DefaultStubImpl, UT_SetHandlerFunction) do not include loops. 
Because there are no other loop controlling expressions in the provided snippets, no additional fragments need investigation for Rule 14.3.
